newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Jan 30.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Jan 30.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Thursday:
* On Wednesday, the Dow Jones industrial average ended up 84.66 points at 6,740.74, its best gain since Jan. 3 when it surged 102 points, due to rally in blue-chip stocks.
* Indonesia will export nearly 2.2 million tonnes of palm oil in 1996/97, a 20 percent gain from the previous year, the U.S. agriculture attache in Jakarta forecast in a report released on Wednesday.
* Indonesia said on Wednesday pre-tax profits of its six state-owned forestry firms were seen falling to 227.32 billion rupiah in 1997 from an estimated 275.06 billion rupiah in 1996.

* On Wednesday, the Jakarta Composite Index closed up 1.36 points, or 0.20 percent, at 691.34 points after hitting a record high of 695.98 points earlier, on heavy profit taking in timber firm Barito Pacific and some heavyweights, brokers said.
* On Thursday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,372.5/73.00 in early trading against the opening of 2,371.50/72.50.
* Indonesian conglomerate Bakrie & Brothers on news it had decided to sell its 49 percent stake in PT Indocopper Investama Corp, which has a 9.36 percent stake in PT Freeport Indonesia.
* Telecommunications firm PT Indonesia Satellite Corp. on news it would join 12 Asian telecommunication firms, including Nippo Telegraph and Telephone Corp, to form multimedia forum

* Poultry, agriculture and food firm Sierad Produce following company denial of possible link up with foreign firms. The company also reported that it expected to book a 398 billion rupiah net profit in 1996 and 770 billion rupiah in 1997.
* State-controlled Bank Negara Indonesia on its denial of merger talk with state-owned Bank Tabungan Negara.
* PT Kedawung Setia following reports the company had signed a $25 million loan on Wednesday.
* Retailer Multipolar and Matahari on Multipolar's extraordinary shareholders' meeting on Thursday at 0330 GMT to seek approval for its plan to take a 50.1 percent controlling stake in Matahari.
